alert.note: Alert for Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 30 at 2:20PM MST until January 01 at 5:00PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible for areas above 7,500 feet. Highest mountain peaks could see amounts up to 15". Winds could gust as high as 45 mph, creating areas of reduced visibilities in blowing and drifting snow on Saturday. * WHERE...The higher terrain of south central and southwest New Mexico. * WHEN...From late tonight through Saturday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Some roads may be closed. Significant travel delays are possible.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. If you must travel in this area, carry an emergency kit in your car. For the latest road conditions, dial 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet; Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range
